greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least prime p such that sum_{k=0}^n A005117(k+1)*x^{n-k} is irreducible modulo p.
comment: Conjecture: For any n>0, we have a(n) <= n*(n+1), and the Galois group of SF_n(x) = sum_{k=0}^n A005117(k+1)*x^{n-k} over the rationals is isomorphic to the symmetric group S_n.
For another related conjecture, see the author's comment on A005117.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..350
example: a(4)=7 since SF_4(x)=x^4+2x^3+3x^2+5x+6 is irreducible modulo 7 but reducible modulo any of 2, 3, 5. It is easy to check that SF_4(x)==(x-2)*(x^3-x^2+x+2) (mod 5).
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Mar 28 2013
